p: Precision medicine aims to tailor treatment in a personalized manner, for the right person at the right time. To achieve this, it uses diagnostic tools to identify specific biomarkers, often genetic, to help assess which medical treatments will be best for each patient [ 2]. Thus, in addition to the mission of providing personalized medicine, the term precision medicine also conveys the concept that genomics and other emerging biodata sciences will improve medicineâ€™s clinically defined nosology [ 3].
